Identifying Characteristics: Forms dense light-green mat comprised of filaments that are joined hexagonally, resembling a net
The net-like appearance is more clearly visible when the water is squeezed out of the mat.
Under the microscope the net arrangement of the cells is the most obvious feature that distinguishes Hydrocictyon from other algae.
Biology: Reproduction is asexual, by vegetative cell division
Indicator of very high nitrogen and phosphorus levels
Range: Worldwide, but less associated with high nutrients in New Zealand
